faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreigners have the same property purchase rights as Spanish citizens in Spain. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number), which our team assists with throughout the process. No visa is required specifically for property purchase, though residency permits may be relevant depending on your circumstances. The process is straightforward with proper legal guidance.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €155,000 purchase price, expect approximately 6-8% in additional costs including property transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), and registration fees (0.5%). Legal fees for a solicitor typically run €1,500-2,500. These costs are standard across Spanish property transactions and ensure legal clarity and security. Our team provides transparent breakdowns before committing to any purchase.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value for Mediterranean living. Monthly expenses for a couple average €1,500-2,500 including rent, utilities, groceries, dining, and entertainment. Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets keep grocery costs low. Healthcare is affordable, especially with Spanish social security. Compared to UK coastal areas, living costs are 30-40% lower while enjoying superior climate and lifestyle.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Oui, la Costa Blanca est un excellent property investment location. Values have appreciated 8% year-on-year, demonstrating sustained market confidence. The region combines affordable entry prices with strong rental income potential (€800+/week typical for holiday properties), established expat infrastructure, year-round sunshine, and authentic Mediterranean culture. Benitachell specifically attracts quality-focused buyers seeking less-developed coastal charm.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Les taxes foncières annuelles (IBI) in Benitachell average 0.4-0.7% of cadastral value yearly—typically €400-700 per year for properties in this price range. Rental income from holiday lets is taxed as business income at progressive rates (19-45%). Capital gains taxes apply if you later sell at profit, taxed at 19% for residents, 24% for non-residents. Proper accounting ensures compliance and tax optimization.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typically, you can borrow 50-80% of property value at competitive rates (currently 3-4%). Requirements include proof of income, NIE, and usually a Spanish bank account. Lenders often favor EU/UK nationals. At €155,000, this property is accessible for cash buyers while remaining attractive for those seeking financing options.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of sunshine annually. Summer temperatures reach 28-32°C (July-August), while winters stay mild at 10-15°C. Rainfall is modest, concentrated in autumn and spring. Sea temperatures range 16°C (winter) to 27°C (summer). This consistent, sunny climate makes year-round holiday use and outdoor living the norm—perfect for vacation properties.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca has become Europe's premier retirement destination, combining affordable living, quality healthcare, year-round sunshine, and established expat communities. Benitachell specifically attracts retirees seeking authentic Mediterranean living over developed resort areas. Healthcare accessibility, English-speaking services, and leisure activities (golf, beaches, cultural events) make it ideal for active retirees seeking lifestyle enrichment.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport, 75 minutes from Benitachell, offers direct flights to UK cities (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Edinburgh) with flight times of 2-2.5 hours. Multiple daily departures from major UK airports make regular trips straightforward. Ferry options via Mediterranean ports provide alternative travel, while budget airlines keep airfare competitive, typically €30-80 return.
